Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 030020 PPK, a disposition shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 020573 ZMK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Lutheran Medical Center, Brooklyn (C030020PPK)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report and the date prior to which the council shall conduct public hearings and the date by which the council shall submit a report or reports pertaining thereto, the date of submission by the director of management and budget and the director of city planning of a draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the city planning commission of a report on the draft ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary certificate regarding debt and reserves and appropriations and expenditures for capital projects, the date of submission by the mayor of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report on revenues and expenditures, the date of submission by the community boards of statements in regard to the preliminary budget, the date of submission by the commissioner of finance of an estimate of the assessed valuation of real property and statement of real property taxes due, expected to be received, and uncollected, the date of submission by the mayor of a tax benefit report, the date of submission by the borough boards of statements on budget priorities, the date of submission by the council of estimates of the financial needs of the council, the date of submission by the borough presidents of proposed modifications of the preliminary budget, the date of publication by the director of the independent budget office of a report analyzing the preliminary budget, the date by which the council shall hold hearings and submit recommendations in regard to the preliminary budget, and the date of submission by the campaign finance board of estimates of the financial needs of the campaign finance board, relating to the fiscal year two thousand six.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Date of submission by the mayor of a preliminary management report.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Public Safety

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of a rifle or shotgun to anyone under twenty-one years of age and requiring dealers in rifles and shotguns to collect additional information from ammunition purchasers.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of a rifle or shotgun to anyone under 21 years of age.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Provide the public with information regarding school violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a cause of action against firearms manufacturers and dealers.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creating a cause of action against certain weapons dealers and manufacturers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to assault weapons.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Approved by Council
Items.MatterName: Assault Weapons

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the acquisition of a rifle or shotgun to one per ninety-day period.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Limiting the acquisition of a firearm to one per ninety-day period.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Legislature to amend that section of the New York State General Business Law known as the Pistol and Revolver Ballistic Identification Databank Law, to require that assault weapons, rifles and other long-barreled weapons be included in New York State’s ballistics fingerprint database.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Gallagher and Lanza.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Pistol and Revolver Ballistic Identification Databank Law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend various sections of the Penal Law to better combat illegal gun trafficking.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Amend Penal Law to better combat illegal gun trafficking.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to approve legislation that establishes a national ballistics fingerprint database.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2  Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Gallagher and Lanza.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: "Ballistics, Law Assistance, and Safety Technology Act" ("BLAST Act")

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to include the denial of a weapons permit for any applicant convicted of violating New York City’s assault weapons ban.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Gallagher, Lanza and Oddo..

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Penal Law to include the denial of a weapons permit for any applicant convicted of violating NYC’s assault weapons ban.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.

Items.Title: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, January 19, 2005

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following annoucements:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Application no. 20055125 HAX, an Urban Development Action Area Project located at 1105 College Avenue, Council District no. 16, Borough of the Bronx.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.
